intro: Gossypianthus tomentosus, commonly known as the woolly cottonbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage and showy, yellow to orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
